title.value: Plant invasion in Mediterranean Europe: current hotspots and future scenarios
title.justification: The paper is focused on plant invasion regions and future changes in Mediterranean Europe.
title.quote: Plant invasion in Mediterranean Europe: current hotspots and future scenarios

extractions.description: This paper studies the current invasion hotspots of alien plant species in Mediterranean Europe and predicts future scenarios of distribution based on species distribution models. It explores the effect of climate and socioeconomic changes on plant invasions, identifies invasion hotspots, and assesses species' biogeographic and ecological characteristics likely to influence success under future conditions.

type.justification: The paper uses empirical data from vegetation plots and environmental variables to perform species distribution modeling and provide predictions about plant invasions.
type.quote: We searched for the occurrence of alien species in 325 000 vegetation plots extracted from the European Vegetation Archive (EVA; Chytrý et al. 2016).

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on ecological patterns of plant invasion in Mediterranean ecosystems and their future scenarios.
name.quote: The Mediterranean Basin has historically been subject to alien plant invasions that threaten its unique biodiversity.

name.justification: The paper extensively involves species distribution models to predict and analyze the spread of invasive species.
name.quote: We used SDMs to estimate the regional niche in Mediterranean Europe and the global niche for each of the 92 alien species.

name.justification: The paper analyzes the impact of climate change on invasion patterns.
name.quote: Future conditions will lead to declines in many currently widespread aliens, which will tend to move to higher elevations and latitudes.

name.justification: The findings are used to assist conservation management in prioritizing interventions based on species invasion scenarios.
name.quote: Ultimately, this knowledge helps prioritize possible interventions.

name.justification: The paper uses these models to predict species invasions.
name.quote: We used SDMs to estimate the regional niche in Mediterranean Europe and the global niche for each of the 92 alien species.

is_contributed.justification: While the paper uses SDMs extensively, it does not claim to contribute new models but rather uses existing methods.
is_contributed.quote: We used SDMs to estimate the regional niche in Mediterranean Europe and the global niche for each of the 92 alien species.

is_executed.justification: The models were executed to obtain predictions of plant invasions across Mediterranean Europe, suggesting computations were involved.
is_executed.quote: The evaluation was performed by measuring the area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve.

is_compared.justification: The paper describes using SDMs for predictive purposes rather than comparing them with other models numerically.
is_compared.quote: Comparing predictions based on the global versus the regional niche of species allowed us to 1) provide a consensus map

referenced_paper_title.value: Measuring ecological niche overlap from occurrence and spatial environmental data: measuring niche overlap
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is used to describe niche measurement relevant to SDMs.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Broennimann, O., Fitzpatrick, M. C., Pearman, P. B., Petitpierre, B., Pellissier, L., Yoccoz, N. G., Thuiller, W., Fortin, M., Randin, C., Zimmermann, N. E., Graham, C. H. and Guisan, A. 2012. Measuring ecological niche overlap from occurrence and spatial environmental data: measuring niche overlap.

name.justification: The paper uses data from this archive for analyzing species occurrence.
name.quote: We searched for the occurrence of alien species in 325 000 vegetation plots extracted from the European Vegetation Archive (EVA; Chytrý et al. 2016).

referenced_paper_title.value: European Vegetation Archive (EVA): an integrated database of European vegetation plots
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference pertaining to the EVA dataset as an important data source for the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Chytrý, M. et al. 2016. European Vegetation Archive (EVA): an integrated database of European vegetation plots.

name.justification: GBIF is mentioned as a source for global occurrences of alien species.
name.quote: For GBIF data, we followed the same resampling and filtering procedure as used for the EVA data.

referenced_paper_title.value: Global rise in emerging alien species results from increased accessibility of new source pools
referenced_paper_title.justification: The GBIF is referenced as a global data source for species occurrences.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Seebens, H. et al. 2018. Global rise in emerging alien species results from increased accessibility of new source pools.

name.justification: The paper uses this R package for modeling species distributions.
name.quote: To model the potential distribution of each species, we used the R package ‘Biomod 2’ (Thuiller et al. 2009).

referenced_paper_title.value: BIOMOD – a platform for ensemble forecasting of species distributions
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the Biomod framework used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Thuiller, W., Lafourcade, B., Engler, R. and Araújo, M. B. 2009. BIOMOD – a platform for ensemble forecasting of species distributions.

name.justification: This R package is used to clean GBIF occurrence data.
name.quote: Moreover, we further post-processed GBIF data (R package ‘CoordinateCleaner’).

referenced_paper_title.value: coordinatecleaner: standardized cleaning of occurrence records from biological collection databases
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper on CoordinateCleaner library is cited as a data cleaning tool used.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Zizka, A., Silvestro, D., Andermann, T., Azevedo, J., Duarte Ritter, C., Edler, D., Farooq, H., Herdean, A., Ariza, M., Scharn, R., Svantesson, S., Wengström, N., Zizka, V. and Antonelli, A. 2019. coordinatecleaner: standardized cleaning of occurrence records from biological collection databases.
